alert.note: Alert for Sabine; San Augustine (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 22 at 10:08PM CDT until March 25 at 5:48AM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas... Ayish Bayou Near San Augustine affecting Sabine and San Augustine Counties. For the Ayish Bayou...including San Augustine...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Ayish Bayou Near San Augustine. * WHEN...Until early Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Lowland flooding will slowly decrease during the next few days. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 PM CDT Tuesday the stage was 11.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 14.1 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 14.1 feet on 05/08/1984. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. For more hydrologic information, copy and paste the following website address into your favorite web browser URL bar: water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=shv The next statement will be issued Wednesday evening at 1015 PM CDT.
